data.prayer: Father, look after and teach the way that is best for the 5,184 believers living in Mamou, Guinea.
data.verse: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go. I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Mamou, Guinea
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Spirit, teach the 5,184 believers in Mamou that when they seek first your Kingdom and your righteousness, you will abundantly provide all they need.
data.verse: And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work.

data.section_summary: On average, 70 people will die without Jesus in the next 100 hours in Mamou, Guinea.
data.prayer: Jesus, send your gospel to these.
Jesus, raise up prophets and truth speakers in your church in Mamou, Guinea so that the church can grow in every way into the mature body of you its head.
data.verse: Instead, speaking the truth in love, we will grow to become in every respect the mature body of him who is the head, that is, Christ.

data.prayer: Spirit, help the fearful in Mamou, Guinea to submit to God and resist the devil.
data.verse: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

data.prayer: Father, I pray that the Yalunka people will not be afraid or ashamed. Prevent them from being confounded or disappointed in their search for you. May the Yalunka people know you.
Father, you said, "The earth belongs to Me and all that is in it". Please, call Mamou, Guinea into obedience and eternal life.
data.verse: The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness; the world, and those who dwell therein.

data.prayer: Lord, please give apostles to expand the church into every neighborhood of Mamou, Guinea.
data.verse: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you.

data.prayer: Spirit, please convict the believers in Mamou, Guinea to not assume the ministry is for professional clergy, but for all who have been called by you.
